results.title: Metropollen
results.brief_description: This interactive game allows the users to create a visually stunning showcase of abstract art that intertwines properties of both nature and technology by cultivating a garden of urban city structures.

results.title: Metropolis
results.creator_credit: Toho Kabushiki Kaisha, Mad House, Masao Maruyama, Iwao Yamaki and Taro Rin
results.brief_description: Combining traditional cell animation with state of the art computer animation, Metropolis wildly re-imagines Fritz Lang’s 1927 silent film of the same name. Based on the 1945 Manga comic by Osamu Tezuka (Astroboy, Kimba the white lion), Metropolis conjures a dystopic, unspecified future where a sprawling city becomes a battleground between the elite ruling class and the subterranean dwelling robots, created to run the capital’s mammoth industry. A young boy named Kenichi and his detective uncle arrive into this troubled city to investigate an underground organization whose main agenda is to annihilate androids. As the cities citizens move closer to total anarchy, Kenici befriends an advanced female robot who was created for ominous dictator Duke Red in the image of his dead daughter. Director Taro Rin and writer Katsuhiro Otomo (Akira) combine Lang’s classic tale (apparently Tezuka’s original inspiration for the comic was a poster he saw for Lang’s Metropolis, subsequently writing the story without ever seeing the film) with more contemporary works such as Ridley Scott’s Blade Runner, creating a visually spectacular hybrid of science fiction, film noir and Manga comics.

results.title: Metrication: the task for management
results.creator_credit: Tony Matthews, British Broadcasting Corporation and Charles Pascoe
results.brief_description: Indicates to management how to plan and co-ordinate the changeover to metric working in order to minimise cost and maximise benefits. The first film considers the context of metrication, and identifies the tasks required to carry out the change.

results.title: Metrication: managing the change over
results.creator_credit: Tony Matthews, British Broadcasting Corporation and Charles Pascoe
results.brief_description: Attempts to show how a company changeover to the metric system can be planned and implemented in order to minimise costs and maximise benefits. Indicates the type of senior management decisions required following the initial tasks survey and discusses how metrication should be implemented, timed and monitored in relation to cost effectiveness.

results.title: Metric
results.brief_description: A little of the history of measurement. Metric is the whimsical story of the ubiquitous metre, It promises to do nice things for us, like wiping out confusion. It even promises to be simple and logical, a luxury we can hardly afford to neglect. Or is the whole film just a pretext for entertainment? In any case, the film comes up with mathematics that are eminently digestible, even to the arithmetically disinclined.

results.title: Methods of water rescue
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith, Maria Boldini and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
A team of schoolboys demonstrate, both on land and in the water, methods of rescue, release and resuscitation. Shows methods of rescue for calm and struggling patients; release from the clutch of a panic-stricken patient; rescue methods for an unconscious patient; resuscitation by the Schaeffer methods; restoration of blood circulation by massage of the limbs. The film concludes with demonstration of a number of fancy swimming strokes.

results.title: Methods of family planning
results.creator_credit: John Churchill, Moreland-Latchford Productions and Jan Steen
results.brief_description: Accurately and objectively explains the human reproductive cycle and all presently practised methods of practising it are seen as a matter of personal choice. Illustrates by animation. Avoids social and moral considerations.
